response.overview: K. Tzetnik, the Holocaust author who sold millions of copies and shaped it's memory in Israel, was and remained an enigma. The writer who was hiding all of his life under a pseudonym, has appeared to the public for the first time while giving his testimony on the Eichmann trial. In a short testimony of a few minutes, he coined the term "The Other Planet" to describing Auschwitz and fainted. He was immortalised in the Israeli consciousness. The film is lightning up the man who lived under two names. Yehiel Di Nur as a family man and K. Tzetnik - the writer who returned to Auschwitz. The film brings back a chapter in his life that wasn't discussed much - his theraphy with the use of LSD which brought him new insights about one of the greatest crimes of humanity.
response.title: The Return from the Other Planet
